question_text: Which of the following are true about containers? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: They run on top of a shared host operating system
They require fewer system resources than VMs
They always include a guest OS for compatibility
They can only interact if the container platform is configured to allow it
correct_answer: They run on top of a shared host operating system
They require fewer system resources than VMs
They can only interact if the container platform is configured to allow it
explanation: Containers use the host OS, are resource-efficient, and operate in isolation by default unless networked together.
